intro: Distichia muscoides, commonly known as the mossy clubmoss, is a small evergreen plant belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and its ability to form dense mats on rocky or acidic soils. The plant has needle-like leaves that are arranged in two rows, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in temperate regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Distichia muscoides plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
